page.title: 10HOUSING IN HENLLAN
page.content: The spatial growth of Henllan has been markedly uneven. The oldest part is on the western edge of the village between the church and around the focus of the roads.Here the houses are mainly late C19 and consist of small terraces built of local limestone.The steep sided valley to the west stopped further expansion in that direction.An estate of approx.50 council houses was built on the eastern side in the mid C20 but it is since 1970 that there has been a considerable expansion of housing on the eastern side of the village in the form of several private housing estates with a mixture of houses and bungalows.The most recent development has been the infilling of smaller plots.
